Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2014 07:17AM MemereL wrote: I love this thread! You ladies are all so funny. I also hate all the pink stuff. High school football players and cheer leaders wearing pink does nothing to help the cause. All it did is made money for the people making those pink things.  Everyone knows that breast cancer is there and everyone knows that mammograms can screen for them.  How about having pamphlets in doctors offices that tell about other signs (example retracted nipples, discharge from nipples, puckered skin) that people may not be aware could be signs of cancer. How about not reminding chemo patients with no hair by waving pink curling irons and blow dryers in front of them. How about not having giant pink bras to remind women that they have no breasts? Insensitive!

Posts.Content: MemereL wrote: Hi. I am still in diagnostic stages (BiRad 4c). I am scheduled with the surgeon on Monday to discuss details of the having the biopsy done.  I live about 30 miles south of Boston. So far, I am dealing with local doctors and radiologists, etc. If I do have cancer, I think I would want to go to Dana Farber. At what point should I think about switching there. It is a hassle getting in and out of the city, but I think I want surgeons that only do breasts as opposed to ones that do hemorroids (sp?), hernias, and gall bladders. Do you think stick with local surgeon for biopsy and if it is cancer, then switch?  This is so stressful! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2014 11:14PM MemereL wrote: I am not a medical professional, so please check with you doctor with these questions. I can tell you about my own experience. I have a history of having cysts since I was in my 20's. I am in my 50's now. I have always been told they "looked" like benign cysts and I just need to have mammograms every year. A couple of times they said in 6 months.  I am on this site now at age 56 due to other breast symptoms and am having tests to see if it is cancer.

Posts.Title: worried MemereL LexiGirl33931

Posts.Content: MemereL wrote: I scheduled a mammogram about 6 weeks after noticing that my left nipple was suddenly inverted and could not be brought back out.  This was very unusual for me.  Also, I have always had milky discharge from my both breasts my whole adult life.  However, a couple of months ago that stopped in the same breast that had the nipple change even though it still happens in the other side. I had the mammogram and they called me to come in for further magnified views and ultrasound. I scheduled that for 2 weeks later. When I went to my doctor's office, she looked at the initial mammogram report (from the first one) and said that I had calcifications.  She told me to move up the followup views and that she would have her office do that for me. She also had me booked with a surgeon.  My followup views are 2 days from now and the surgeon visit 6 days after that.  I have myself convinced that it must be cancer due to the outward signs and the fact that she booked me with a surgeon even before the followup views were done and that she though an extra week or so was a problem. I feel that I can cope better emotionally if I an feel like I am in some control. But, I don't even know the right questions to ask. Any advice or input? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: worried MemereL LexiGirl33931

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2014 12:48AM MemereL wrote: Finally getting a biopsy tomorrow morning and should have results Friday.
Posts.Title: worried MemereL LexiGirl33931

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2014 09:48PM MemereL wrote: Just want to let everyone know that I got the preliminary patholgy results and they are benign. The radiologist just has to look at it and make sure the areas biopsied agree with their recommended spots.  But, all looks good. The report said duct ectasia and complex non-cancerous cysts. I was sure to put results on here because I know how upset and worried I was especially when I saw one cancer diagnosis after another.
Posts.Title: worried MemereL LexiGirl33931

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2014 03:18AM - edited Oct 7, 2014 03:21AM by MemereL Now, I am getting so very annoyed.  I had the initial suspicious mammogram on Sept 16 and the magnified views, ultrasound, tomosynthesis on Sept 30th. The radiologist said I definitely still need the biopsy, but she said I should have an MRI first because the biopsy changes how things appear on the MRI. She said that the breast surgeon had to order the MRI. I spent almost 2 days trying to talk to people in the BS office to get the MrI sceduled and they said to wait until my appt which was scheduled for Oct 6.  When I mentioned the difficulty I was having trying to reach anyone n that office, the nurse laughed. Yes laughed. I went there today and what a waste of waiting a week. He said I needed the MRI (no kidding) and that he wouldn't even know what method of biopsy until the results of the MRI.  Then about 5 days to get results of the MRI. (HUH?) Then he said he probably wouldn't even be the one to do the biopsy, the radiologist would.  Well, why did I even need to go to him, then? Why couldn't my primary just order the MRI and the biopsy?  Anyhow now another week to wait for the MRI. I am so annoyed. I am calling a Boston hospital and hopefully get more efficient treatment. On top of being so very worried, I shouldn't have to deal with this aggravation. Sorry, just needed to vent! PS on ultrasound report it said they also noticed debris under the nipple, but said no evidence of solid and also said no evidence of liquid. How can that be? Are there not only 3 states of matter? Certainly, it is not a gas!
Posts.Title: worried MemereL LexiGirl33931

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2014 03:55AM MemereL wrote: Thanks! But, as I am sure everyone on this site knows, waiting is so hard.  I just keep looking at the fact that my mother had breast cancer and I have calcifications, some other mass, suddenly retracted nipple, debris in duct, dilated, prominent duct, I started periods early and didn't go through menopause til I was 55, almost 56. Then, I have dense breast. You put all of those things into the equation and it seems like I am doomed! Thanks again!
